Is it time for email newsletters to make a comeback for Web 3 projects? Having a reliable means of communication only strengthens communities. How can we adapt what we already have to meet the needs of Web 3?
Twitter is great for pushing out updates but similar to the Discord fatigue problem, you donâ€™t really know if your community is reading.
Discord seems to be the de-facto home for most projects. Shame that most hacks seem to happen via Discord and a lot of users are feeling Discord fatigue.

â€œPROJECT HACKED, DO NOT MINTâ€ seems to be ever more common these days and highlights a massive problem in the NFT space - projects do not have a robust means of communicating with and providing updates to their communities.

NFT mints should be ran like Japanese railways. 

Respect your community by starting on time and testing everything beforehand. Otherwise the only way to atone is through seppuku.
